fields.description:
Reproduced with Chrome version 28.0.1500.52.

+Repro steps:+
# Create a page.
# Start a bullet list.
# Copy and paste multiple lines of plain text in the line by the bullet.
# Observe problem: All multiple lines are withing the same bullet point. By pressing enter in the middle of the text, a new line will be added with the right indexation but no bullet.

This happens only with Chrome. It works fine on Firefox and IE.
fields.summary: Copy and paste multiple lines in bullet list does not work as expected in Google Chrome

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29747].
  {panel}

h5. Scenario
When you access Confluence on the base URL (http://something.com/confluence) you will first get redirected to http://something.com/confluence/homepage.action to determine the home page setting, based on which you will be redirected to the homepage set at *Confluence Admin > General Configuration*. This is 2 redirects just by accessing the base URL.

Google in some cases drops out such sites from search indexing, since they have too many redirects and this is very problematic in the case when Confluence is used as public facing Wiki and the homepage itself would be the entry link from where Google would proceed crawling through the links.

The solution would be to eliminate any redirects when accessing the site without login.
fields.summary: Avoid redirection on public access (Confluence facing public)

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a user that has a non latin character in his name, e.g. John Stærk
# Navigate to a confluence page
# Create a new comment
# Enter as the data a mention to John Stærk
# Set a breakpoint on line 122 of {{EditorLinkBodyUnmarshaller}}, i.e. {code}if (StringUtils.equals(defaultAlias, linkBodyString)){code}
# Click Save

*Expected Outcome:*
The default alias that contains the plain text representation of John Stærk should match the unicode representation, John Stærk. Either that, or the default alias should be the unicode representation at this point, resulting in the current representation matching.

*Actual Outcome:*
A blind comparison is done, which ignores whether it is unicode altogether, which interprets the values as different, and therefore determines that the body text should be stored (unnecessarily, as the default alias provides the necessary information)

This has caused a bug to surface in Confluence Dashboard All Updates [CONF-28169|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-28169]. This does not completely fix CONF-28169 as it only addresses the ID/label variance, not whether it should be an ID or a label. More details are in  [STRM-2133|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/STRM-2133] which was incorrectly linked.
fields.summary: Unmarshalling of links when transforming Editor XHTML store CDATA when there are non-latin characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29739].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

1) Create a table with 2 lines and 4 columns
2) In the first line of the tables, you can write in each column: Name of the Client, Address, Phone and Comment.
3) Then fill the second row of the second column with random characters.
4) The table will grow to the right, which is expeted.
5) When it reaches the size of the page, instead of growing more to the right, it will create a blank line in the first row.

Screenshots attached for more detail.
fields.summary: First row been changed when the second row is increased

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29737].
  {panel}

Hi Team,

There is a bug that can be annoying some customers.

When we add images on Confluence and want to display those images using a Gallery macro filtering them by their labels, the system is behaving differently than to what is stated in the documentation ([Gallery Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Gallery+Macro]).

The parameter *Include Images with these Labels Only* is using "OR" instead of "AND".

EX:
 Image 1, Labels:"atlassian","confluence"
 Image 2, Labels:"confluence", "gallery"
 Image 3, Labels:"gallery","macro"

If we create a gallery specifying the labels to include as "confluence","gallery" we will get Image 1, 2, and 3 as opposed to only getting Image 2.
fields.summary: Gallery Macro Labels Using OR instead of AND
Ability to make changes to documents Live

fields.description:
5.1.3 Confluence standalone on Solaris. JDK 1.7.x
Use "Edit in Office" to open .docx or .xlsx document.
Make changes and attempt to Save.
Generates error message:
"Upload failed  Your changes were saved but could not be uploaded because of an error. You may be able to upload this file using the server web page."
and you cannot save your changes.
Have gone back and verified that changes are not saved.
If I roll back to a JDK 1.6.x and run the same procedure the changes Save fine, no error messages, I can go back to the document and the changes are saved.
I have repeated this on 2 different installs.
fields.summary: JAVA 1.7.x breaks save in Edit in Office

fields.description:
5.1.3 Confluence standalone on Solaris. I have custom site Logo and have it set to show both logo and title. I update, install or uninstall add-ons and it switches to Show Logo only. I then have to go back in to Look & Feel/Site logo and re-select show Logo & title and save. I have repeated this on 2 seperate installs with 2 different plugins.

I just verified that 5.1.3 standalone for windows behaves the same way. Updating plugin changes site logo options setting.
fields.summary: Custom site logo setting changed by installing, uninstalling or updating add-on

fields.description:
I am testing with Confluence 4.3.7 and have a strange behaviour. Testet e.g. the excerpt macro: When setting the "Display inline" property in the editor, the preview is ok, but after saving the page, the excerpt is rendered as block element. When choosing the "Display on new line" property, the editor renders it on a new line, but after saving, the excerpt seems to be rendered inline! I attach screenshots for the source fragment (preview, view)

The pre INLINE

An excerpt: inline or not?

the post
fields.summary: Display Inline / Display on new line not working correctly

fields.description:
h5. Symptoms

If you have a page which has a multi-column layout, then when using IE8, if the anchors are not in the first column, then only the first anchor link on the page will function. All others will do nothing. Everything works fine in all other browsers, and in later versions of IE.

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page with a multi-column layout
# Put some Anchors in any column other than the first column, far enough that the page needs to scroll to get there
# Add links to those Anchors
# Click the first one, see that it snaps to the anchor
# Click any other link, see that it does absolutely nothing

h5. Workaround

The only workarounds are:

# Use a later version of IE
# Use a different browser
# Don't use a multi-column layout
fields.summary: Anchor links on the same page do not work in IE8 when using multi-column layouts

fields.description:
The attachment macro currently calls a viewfile macro on each item that is a xls,xlsx, and pdf. 

On a page that pulls in many attachments, or on pages with lots of attachment macros, you can end up in a situation where you denial of service yourself (run out of threads in http pool) or cause you to run out of memory (due to lots of requests for view file at the same time).

The macro should either limit, or there ought to be a flag to disable this behavior.
fields.summary: Items displayed in Attachments macro can cause system instability

h4.Steps to Reproduce:
 This issue only happens in Internet Explorer 8 and 9, and it can be reproduced in Confluence 5.x. 
 
# Edit a page in Confluence.
# Create a table with two or more rows
# Create an unordered list inside row 1. 
# Remove row 2 from your table (Not row 1 which contains the unordered list). 

 h4.Expected Results:
 If a row is deleted from a table, user should  still be able to edit the table as he/she wishes.

h4.Actual Results:
When a row is deleted from a table, user is not able to edit the table anymore.
 
h4.Findings:
This issue only occurs in 5.x using Internet Explorer 8 and 9. I tested this on Confluence 4.3.7 and it works just fine with no issue.

h4.Workaround:
Press *preview* button, and then press *Edit* to come back to the edit mode. You can the edit the table again.
fields.summary: Unable to modify table with unordered list after removing a row in IE

As confirmed in issue JST-67733, there is no way to disable displaying the "Child Pages" list in OnDemand.

For us, this is a major disturbance. It means that every page with lots of subpages is very cluttered and the comment section of that page is virtually unusable, since you'd first have to scroll for half a year before getting down there.

Thanks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29697].
  {panel}

The page properties macro is only able to retrieve property values from its own body text if the properties are contained within a HTML table element that declares a TBODY element containing its rows.

According to the HTML 5 spec, the TBODY element may be omitted from a table declaration if the table contains only TR elements and no table header and footer. (http://www.w3.org/TR/html-markup/tbody.html#tbody-tags)

This means that if another macro embedded within the page properties macro produces table output, even if the output of the macro is well-formed and valid HTML or Confluence Storage Format, the properties may not always be picked up.

This is the case for Bob Swift's SQL Query macro, which generates table output that omits the TBODY element declaration.
fields.summary: Page Properties macro cannot determine properties from a well-formed table generated by a child macro

fields.description:
After creating a link to an anchor on the same page as the link, it is no longer possible to edit that link. The "edit" option is displayed but clicking on the button has no effect, but if you create a link to the same anchor on another page, (different to the one containing the anchor), then you can edit that link as expected but if the link is on the same page as the anchor you cannot edit it.

*Steps to reproduce:*

1. Add an anchor macro to a page
2. Create a link to that anchor on the same page
3. Save the page, then try to edit the link to the anchor after the page has been saved.

This has been tested and reproduced in Chrome v27 and Firefox v20.

*Workaround*

Delete and recreate the link to the anchor by following the instructions in this document: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Working+with+Anchors

I had it fully configured and working, but I deleted the link when I moved the sites behind a virtual host, which changed the BASE URLs for both of them.
I had no option but to delete the link, as I was unable to edit the url displayed.  Now it won’t let me recreate the link.
I believe I’m having the same issues as this guy: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/153001/an-error-occurred-when-trying-to-create-the-application-link-in-the-remote-application-link-confluence-to-jira

Any support you can provide would be appreciated.

Thanks,
Matt

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29672].
  {panel}


ID: CONF-001 - Information Exposure
CWE ID: 200
CWE Description: An information exposure is the intentional or unintentional disclosure of information to an actor that is not explicitly authorized to have access to that information.
Additional description: One REST service (/rest/likes/1.0/content) doesn't (properly) authenticate requests. An anonymous user can request a list of 'likes' from arbitrary pages that aren't accessible for anonymous users. Confluence returns a list of Confluence usernames as well as full usernames that 'like' that page.
This could help an attacker: By bruteforcing page_ID it's possible to obtain a list of usernames and full usernames of all persons that have 'liked' one or more pages.
Affected URL(s):
/rest/likes/1.0/content/<page_ID>/likes
/rest/likes/1.0/content/<page_ID>/comment-likes
fields.summary: /rest/likes/1.0/content does not check page permissions properly

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:

1. Add a line of text. _(Type anything.)_
2. Make it a header, e.g. h2.
3. Send a carriage return to create new line of text above the header. (This line should have paragraph formatting by default.)
4. Before you enter any text on this new line, press delete. This should move the header text up one level, into this line.
5. Confluence lists the formatting of the header as "Paragraph", and the line of text no longer has spacing above the text like it would if it were a header; however, the text is still the same size as it was when it was a regular line of header text.
6. Examine the Table of Contents macro. (Create a new one if needed.) You'll see that the malfunctioning header line appears in the TOC as if it were still a header; however, it appears in a larger font within the TOC itself, which is not normal.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29664].
  {panel}

Hello, We have noticed that Confluence adds a prefix to anchor names, which is really odd.
When I add an anchor macro to a page, with name lets say 'prices' the anchor is renamed to 'pagename-prices' and a link like 'confluenceinstalation/wiki/display/pagename#prices' <- doesn't work. 
We have to use the prefixed anchor which would be 'confluenceinstalation/wiki/display/pagename#pagename-prices. Why the redundant page name? 
This means the anchor will change the name with the page. If I use a link like the above it's not a big inconvenience , but all short links will be invalid, and also links of type 'viewpage.action?pageId=12313#pagename-prices' will become invalid if the 'pagename' is changed to lets say 'changedname'. Now the links would be 'viewpage.action?pageId=12313#changedname-prices' also short links will change like '/xTxY/WszA#changedname-prices'. If the anchor was not prefixed all those links would still be valid. I am also talking about the heading anchors that are generated automatically. 

Can this be made configurable, so that we can choose if Confluence should add prefix to the anchor name or no prefix at all?
fields.summary: Page name prefix in anchors

When Confluence is connected with Crowd and Crowd fails during the time that a user is using Confluence, the following stacktrace is displayed : 
{noformat}
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.CommunicationException
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.convertOperationFailedException(CrowdServiceImpl.java:866)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.authenticate(CrowdServiceImpl.java:79)

fields.description:
Confluence activity stream macro does not allow user to edit the settings and de-select JIRA/Confluence inclusion in the configuration.

When you de-select confluence or JIRA from the config menu, click save in the preview pane, and click save in the macro window, the settings do not persist.

For reproducing:
Stood up Confluence 4.3.3 against Mysql 5.x
Default confluence install, demonstration space
Application link to JIRA 5.2
Add activity stream macro to default demo space homepage
De-select either confluence or jira in activity stream macro configuration (preview pane side)
Click save.
Save macro.

Activity from both applications still shows in stream. Edit macro configuration again, both Confluence and JIRA are shown as selected.

Only affected on version 4.3.3. Do not experience this on 5.1.3.
Plugin version:
Confluence Activity Stream Plugin 5.0.11
fields.summary: Activity stream macro does not allow JIRA/Confluence to be disabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29645].
  {panel}

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/JIRA+Issues+Macro#JIRAIssuesMacro-Parameters

Your documentation says "Example columns are: key, summary, type, created, fixversion, updated, due, assignee, reporter, priority, status and resolution." 

However if you add "key, summary, type" into the text box, it doesn't work. If you read more and find out that you should be using semicolons, you might try "key; summary; type", but that also doesn't work, because there are spaces. It really needs "key;summary;type". 

I would suggest either changing the example that you give in the help text, or making the parsing a bit more user-friendly.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29639].
  {panel}

There appears to have been a change on the Twitter end of the connection so embedding Twitter feeds in the Widget Connector no longer works. When embedding a Twitter URL and clicking preview nothing is displayed, even though the instances had their whitelists disabled.

This behaviour has been reproduced in Confluence v4.3.7, v5.1.3 and also on the EAC. When changing the embedded URL for a YouTube video the content was embedded as expected, which suggests this is Twitter specific.

Related WC ticket: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/WC-61

h3. Workaround
# [Enable HTML Macros in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Enabling+HTML+macros]
# Create a [Twitter widget|https://help.twitter.com/en/using-twitter/embed-twitter-feed] by entering your Twitter URL to https://publish.twitter.com/#
# Copy the code for the widget into a HTML macro on your page
fields.summary: Twitter feeds have stopped working in the Widget Connector

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

Confluence is filling the temp directory with files named like imageio*.tmp. These are used in the generation of thumbnails, for example by the gallery macro. These files are being held open by Confluence, and eventually Confluence's process runs out of available file handles, and produces "Too many open files" errors in the log.

h4. Cause

The imageio objects are not being finalised correctly, holding both the file handle and the object open. This results in a file handle leak, but also in a memory/object leak.

h4. Solution

This issue does not occur in any version later than 3.5.x
fields.summary: Confluence keeps thumbnail imageio temp files open after they have expired

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29634].
  {panel}

We should document the Confluence.Binder components.

This will be particularly useful for plugin developers who write forms on pages. 

*Background:* 

In Confluence 5.2, we introduced a nice new feature for developers: "Multi-user selection fields". This is not very useful for developers who want to be able to use it in the macro browser. They would have to get into the complexity of {{setMacroJsOverride}}.

But not all plugin developers live in the macro browser. Sometimes they write forms on pages too. For example, a plugin that asks people to enter comma-separated usernames. Adding a class to the field would greatly improve the UX.

We currently don't have any public documentation on the Confluence.Binder components, and for that reason we didn't document the new "Multi-user selection fields" feature either.
fields.summary: Developer docs: Document the Confluence.Binder components

fields.description:
Issues: On some pages in a space the footer is rendered as floating, covering important text, but this is not consistent across the entire space. No amount of editing or changing the page structure affects this. 

Description:
In the Space Admin, I go to Themes, Documentation View and use the following footer, which contains: an anchor, a tip with email links to our support site. 

{anchor:SnowflakeSupport}
{tip:title=You can contact us in the following ways:} \\ Email support \- [support@snowflakesoftware.com|mailto:support@snowflakesoftware.com]
\\ Email for general feedback \- [info@snowflakesoftware.com|mailto:info@snowflakesoftware.com]
\\ Call us - 023 8023 8232 \\ Access the Portal \- [Snowflake Customer Portal|http://support.snowflakesoftware.com/]
For more information about our products & training please visit our website \- [www.snowflakesoftware.com|http://www.snowflakesoftware.com/]
{tip}

On some pages this works fine, and on others not. I am using the same web browser (Chrome) to view all pages.

This is a link to an affected page for you to view:
http://wiki.snowflakesoftware.com/display/GPDOC/GO+Publisher+Workflow+Pre-Requisites
fields.summary: Floating Footer on some pages when using a TIP marcos

fields.description:
Customers who are running Confluence 4.3.x are finding that their indexing becomes broken when Team Calendars v3.2.3 is enabled in their instance. The index appears to run successful but refreshing the page suggests that the Index isn't rebuilt, even though they have just run the process.

Looking in the atlassian-confluence logs, a very distinct error is shown:

{noformat}
2013-06-13 13:50:05,471 ERROR [Indexer: 8] [confluence.search.lucene.ReindexWorkBatch] indexCollection Error indexing document
 -- referer: http://localhost:6430/admin/search-indexes.action | url: /admin/reindex.action | userName: admin | action: reindex
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class com.atlassian.confluence.index.Lucene29FieldDescriptorMapper
	at com.atlassian.labs.lucenecompat.impl.Lucene29AdaptingExtractor.<init>(Lucene29AdaptingExtractor.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.labs.lucenecompat.impl.Lucene29ExtractorFactory.convert(Lucene29ExtractorFactory.java:16)
	at com.atlassian.labs.lucenecompat.spring.DynamicExtractorModuleDescriptorsFactory$CompatibilityExtractor.addFields(DynamicExtractorModuleDescriptorsFactory.java:154)
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.search.BaseDocumentBuilder.getDocument(BaseDocumentBuilder.java:104)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.ConfluenceDocumentBuilder.getDocument(ConfluenceDocumentBuilder.java:97)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.tasks.AddDocumentIndexTask.perform(AddDocumentIndexTask.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.index.TempIndexWriter.perform(TempIndexWriter.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.TempIndexWriterStrategy.perform(TempIndexWriterStrategy.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.tasks.TempIndexBackedIndexTaskPerformer.perform(TempIndexBackedIndexTaskPerformer.java:21)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.ReindexWorkBatch.indexCollection(ReindexWorkBatch.java:125)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.ReindexWorkBatch$1.doInTransaction(ReindexWorkBatch.java:86)
	at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate.execute(TransactionTemplate.java:128)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.ReindexWorkBatch.run(ReindexWorkBatch.java:56)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:439)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:895)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:918)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:680)
{noformat}

*WORKAROUND:*
# Downgrade the plugin to the previous version by removing it from the database by following the instructions in this document to remove the plugin from the database: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Removing+Malfunctioning+Add-ons
# After this you should flush the plugin caches by performing the steps outlined in this document: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+Clear+Confluence+Plugins+Cache
# You can then reinstall v3.2.2 of the plugin, found on this link: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.extra.team-calendars/versions
# Finally, you will need to rebuild the index from scratch by following the instructions in this document: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Rebuild+the+Content+Indices+from+Scratch

*NOTE: Whenever making changes in the database you should ALWAYS backup your data before proceeding!*

The problem will be fixed for Team Calendars  3.2.4
fields.summary: Confluence stops indexing after upgrading Team Calendars plugin to v3.2.3

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29628].
  {panel}

Whenever I create a link in an email or external site that points to a Wiki page I use this format.

    Wiki : "Title of page" (http://wiki.mycompany.com/x/tinylink)

Now I have sufficient self-discipline to keep this up, but most of my colleagues keep on making a mess. Just putting in the address bar URL or only the tiny link. My reason for doing it like this is that it is more descriptive than just a tiny link. And in case that it does break users have a title and the name Wiki to go and search.

My request would be to have this as a complete formatted string available in the "Link to this page" popup that you get when pressing the "k" in view mode. Possibly by making the mask configurable per space.

A plugin or macro that would give me the same effect would be good too. But I prefer it to be in the standard product. Seems like an easy win even.

Regards,
Peter
fields.summary: Custom "Link to this page" link text
Documentation Request: Ondemand to Installed migration with Confluence and JIRA linked

* Click Save  
* The loading takes forever, so I click cancel. (Forever I mean really long, like half a minute or so)

* Comment was added despite the error message.

Next time this happened on the same page, as I wanted to add a reply to my own comment, same thing happens, but comment is not added. I was using Chrome.

Ability to theme the Confluence Mobile sidebar

fields.description:
Anonymous users can view attachments to user profile pages even if *View User Profiles* is restricted in Confluence administration.

To reproduce, do the following:
* In Quick Search, search for a term that reveals such an attachment (among other search results).
* Click on the attachments link and it will be displayed (in our case it has been a piece of source code uploaded as a .txt file).

Workaround:
* Restrict all single User Profile Pages, e.g. to a group that reflects the company.
fields.summary: Anonymous users can view attachments to user profile pages

fields.description:
When disabling the Confluence Sortable Tables plugin all content from the Sidebar is lost and only a grey area is displayed where the Sidebar links and content should be displayed, (see SortableTablesDisabled.png). Re-enabling the plugin returns all the content on the sidebar but then tables become sortable again. 

The problematic module appears to be the "sortable-table-resources" module, but even though disabling the other two modules doesn't cause the problem with the Sidebar it also doesn't prevent the table from being sortable.
fields.summary: Disabling the Confluence Sortable Tables plugin removes all elements from Sidebar
